tool.name: RECETOX apLCMS - align features

configfiles.configfile: #for $infile in $ms_files ln -s '${infile}' '${infile.element_identifier}' #end for #for $infile in $parquet_files ln -s '${infile}' '${infile.element_identifier}' #end for

library(recetox.aplcms)
#set filenames_str = str("', '").join([str($f.element_identifier) for $f in $ms_files]) files_list <- c('$filenames_str') sample_names <- get_sample_name(files_list)
corrected <- arrow::read_parquet("$parquet_file")
aligned <- align_features( sample_names = sample_names, features = corrected, min.exp = $min_exp, mz.tol = $peak_alignment.align_mz_tol, chr.tol = $peak_alignment.align_chr_tol, find.tol.max.d = 10 * $mz_tol, max.align.mz.diff = $peak_alignment.max_align_mz_diff, do.plot = FALSE )
df <- as.data.frame(aligned) arrow::write_parquet(df, "$aligned_feature_sample_table")

param.name: ms_files
param.label: Input data
param.help: Mass spectrometry file for peak extraction.

param.name: parquet_file
param.label: Input corrected feature samples
param.help: Mass spectrometry file containing corrected feature samples.

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: mz_tol
param.help: The m/z tolerance level for the grouping of data points. This value is expressed as the fraction of the m/z value. This value, multiplied by the m/z value, becomes the cutoff level. The recommended value is the machine's nominal accuracy level. Divide the ppm value by 1e6. For FTMS, 1e-5 is recommended.

param.name: min_exp
param.label: min_exp
param.help: If a feature is to be included in the final feature table, it must be present in at least this number of spectra.

tool.help:
This is a tool which runs apLCMS alignment of features.
@GENERAL_HELP@
